alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 4:54AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Atlantic, Ocean, eastern Burlington and southern Monmouth Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 454 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cream Ridge to near Shamong to near Hammonton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Asbury Park, Lakewood, Jackson, Howell, Barnegat, Hammonton, Beachwood, Shamong, Manasquan, Point Pleasant Beach, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Presidential Lakes Estates, Seaside Heights, Lakehurst, Farmingdale, Surf City, Port Republic and Wrightstown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 47 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington; Western Monmouth
